plot: A Survey of Multi-task Learning in Natural Language Processing: Regarding Task Relatedness and Training Methods
summary: Multi-task learning (MTL) has become increasingly popular in natural language processing (NLP) because it improves the performance of related tasks by exploiting their commonalities and differences. It is still not understood very well how multi-task training can be implemented based on the relatedness of training tasks. They present examples in various NLP downstream applications, summarize the task relationships and discuss future directions of this promising topic. They also discuss the role of joint training and multi-step training in NLP.
